schemes.name: PM-Kisan Samman Nidhi
schemes.description: Central scheme that gives Rs 6,000 per year in three equal instalments to small and marginal farmer families.
schemes.eligibility: You must be a small or marginal farmer. Landholding should be in your name. You should be an Indian citizen.
schemes.benefits: Rs 2,000 every 4 months (Rs 6,000 per year) directly in your bank account.
howToApply: Visit the PM-Kisan portal or go to your nearest Common Service Centre (CSC).
Fill the PM-Kisan form with your name, mobile, Aadhaar, bank account and land details.
Submit the form with copies of Aadhaar and land papers.
Your application will be verified. Once approved, money will be sent to your bank account.

schemes.name: Atal Pension Yojana
schemes.description: A pension scheme for workers in the unorganised sector. You get a fixed pension every month after 60 years of age.
schemes.eligibility: You must be between 18 and 40 years. You must have a bank account. You should be an Indian citizen. Mainly for workers without any organised pension.
schemes.benefits: Monthly pension of Rs 1,000 to Rs 5,000 after 60 years, depending on your contribution. Government also adds 50% of your contribution for 5 years (up to Rs 1,000 per year).
howToApply: Open an account with any bank that offers Atal Pension Yojana.
Fill the APY form. Choose your monthly pension amount (Rs 1,000 to Rs 5,000).
Give your Aadhaar and bank details. Consent for auto-debit of monthly contribution.
Pay the monthly contribution on time. Pension will start after you turn 60.

schemes.name: Ayushman Bharat Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana
schemes.description: Health insurance that gives up to Rs 5 lakh per family per year for hospitalisation. No need to pay at the time of treatment.
schemes.eligibility: Your family should be in the listed deprived categories (e.g. rural landless, manual workers). Your name should be in the SECC 2011 data. No age limit.
schemes.benefits: Cashless treatment up to Rs 5 lakh per family per year in empanelled hospitals. Covers most illnesses and surgeries.
howToApply: Check if your family is eligible on the Ayushman Bharat website or at a Common Service Centre.
If eligible, get your Ayushman card from the nearest hospital or CSC.
Show your Ayushman card and Aadhaar at any empanelled hospital for cashless treatment.
You can also call the helpline 14555 for help.

schemes.name: PM Vidya Lakshmi
schemes.description: Single online portal to apply for education loans from many banks. Students can compare and apply for loans easily.
schemes.eligibility: You must be an Indian citizen. You should be admitted to a recognised course (higher education, professional, vocational). Your course and institute should be approved by the bank.
schemes.benefits: One place to apply to multiple banks, track application status, and get education loan without collateral up to Rs 7.5 lakh.
howToApply: Register on the Vidya Lakshmi portal (vidyalakshmi.co.in).
Fill your course and personal details. Choose the loan amount you need.
Select banks and submit the application. Upload required documents.
Banks will contact you. Complete their process and get the loan.

schemes.name: National Pension System (NPS)
schemes.description: A voluntary pension scheme. You save regularly and get a pension after 60. Open to all Indian citizens.
schemes.eligibility: Any Indian citizen between 18 and 70 years can join. You need a bank account and PAN.
schemes.benefits: Tax benefits on contribution. After 60, you get a part as lump sum and rest as monthly pension. You can choose how much to invest.
howToApply: Visit the NPS website or go to any bank or post office that offers NPS.
Fill the subscriber registration form. Choose Tier I (pension) or Tier II (savings).
Submit Aadhaar, PAN and bank details. Pay the minimum amount (Rs 500 for opening).
You will get a PRAN (Permanent Retirement Account Number). Contribute regularly online or at the bank.

schemes.name: Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana
schemes.description: Free LPG connection to women from poor families so they can cook with clean fuel instead of wood or coal.
schemes.eligibility: Adult woman from a household that does not have an LPG connection. Family should be in the eligible list (e.g. SC/ST, PMAY, Antyodaya, forest dwellers, most backward classes).
schemes.benefits: One free LPG connection (cylinder and regulator). You pay only for the first refill. No deposit for the connection.
requiredDocuments: BPL certificate or eligible category proof
howToApply: Go to your nearest LPG distributor (HP, BPCL, IOCL) with your documents.
Fill the Ujjwala application form. Give Aadhaar, address and BPL/eligibility proof.
Submit the form and documents. You will get a receipt.
After verification, you will get a free LPG connection. Book your first cylinder and pay only for the refill.

schemes.name: Mid-Day Meal Scheme
schemes.description: Free cooked midday meal for children studying in government and government-aided schools. Improves nutrition and attendance.
schemes.eligibility: Your child must be enrolled in a government or government-aided primary/upper primary school (Classes 1 to 8).
schemes.benefits: One free nutritious meal every school day. Calories and protein as per guidelines. No cost to the family.
requiredDocuments: Ration card or identity of parent
howToApply: Admit your child in a government or government-aided school (Class 1 to 8).
The school automatically includes eligible children in the mid-day meal list.
No separate form in most states. Child gets the meal on school days.
For any issue, contact the school principal or the district education office.

schemes.name: Pradhan Mantri Matru Vandana Yojana
schemes.description: Cash benefit for pregnant women and new mothers. Rs 5,000 in instalments for first living child to support nutrition and rest.
schemes.eligibility: Pregnant woman or mother of first living child. You should be 19 years or older. Not eligible if you are a government employee or get similar benefits.
schemes.benefits: Rs 2,000 in first instalment (after registration), Rs 2,000 after first vaccination, Rs 1,000 after second vaccination (total Rs 5,000).
howToApply: Register at the nearest Anganwadi centre or health centre when you are pregnant.
Fill the PMMVY form. Give Aadhaar, bank account and pregnancy details.
Submit the form with copies of Aadhaar and bank passbook.
After verification, you will get the first instalment. Get your child vaccinated on time to receive the next instalments.

schemes.name: Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (Urban)
schemes.description: Housing scheme for urban poor. Get financial assistance to buy or build a pucca house.
schemes.eligibility: You must not own a pucca house in your name or family member's name anywhere in India. Economically Weaker Section (EWS), Low Income Group (LIG), Middle Income Group (MIG).
schemes.benefits: Subsidy on home loan interest up to Rs 2.67 lakh. Credit-linked subsidy for buying or constructing house.
howToApply: Visit the PMAY-Urban website and register.
Fill the application form with personal and income details.
Apply through your bank for home loan under PMAY.
Submit required documents. Interest subsidy will be credited after approval.

schemes.name: Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (Gramin)
schemes.description: Housing scheme for rural poor. Get financial assistance of Rs 1.20 lakh (plain areas) or Rs 1.30 lakh (hilly areas) to build pucca house.
schemes.eligibility: You must be a rural resident without a pucca house. Your name should be in the SECC 2011 list. Priority to SC/ST, women, and differently-abled.
schemes.benefits: Rs 1.20 to 1.30 lakh financial assistance in instalments. Toilet, electricity, LPG connection also provided.
howToApply: Your name should be in the SECC list. Check with your Gram Panchayat.
Fill the application form at Gram Panchayat office.
Submit Aadhaar, bank details, and BPL/SECC proof.
After approval, you will receive money in instalments as you build the house.

schemes.name: Beti Bachao Beti Padhao
schemes.description: National programme to address declining Child Sex Ratio and promote girl child education and welfare.
schemes.eligibility: Girl child born in India. Parents should open Sukanya Samriddhi Account for girl child under 10 years.
schemes.benefits: High interest on savings (around 8%). Tax benefits. Maturity amount for girl's education or marriage after 21 years.
howToApply: Open Sukanya Samriddhi Account at post office or authorized bank.
Deposit minimum Rs 250 per year (maximum Rs 1.5 lakh per year).
Account matures when girl turns 21 years.
Partial withdrawal allowed after girl turns 18 for education.

schemes.name: Pradhan Mantri MUDRA Yojana
schemes.description: Loans to micro and small businesses without collateral. Three categories: Shishu (up to Rs 50,000), Kishore (Rs 50,000 to Rs 5 lakh), Tarun (Rs 5 to Rs 10 lakh).
schemes.eligibility: Any Indian citizen with a business plan. Non-corporate, non-farm small/micro enterprises. First-time entrepreneurs or existing businesses.
schemes.benefits: Low-interest loan without collateral. Easy processing. Helps start or expand small business.
howToApply: Prepare a business plan and cost estimate.
Approach any bank or NBFC offering MUDRA loans.
Fill the loan application form. Submit business plan and documents.
Bank will assess and approve. Loan will be disbursed in your account.

schemes.name: Stand-Up India Scheme
schemes.description: Bank loans between Rs 10 lakh and Rs 1 crore to SC/ST and women entrepreneurs for greenfield enterprises.
schemes.eligibility: SC/ST and/or women entrepreneur above 18 years. For setting up a new enterprise in manufacturing, services or trading sector.
schemes.benefits: Loan between Rs 10 lakh to Rs 1 crore. Margin money requirement only 15-25%. Composite loan including working capital.
howToApply: Register on Stand-Up India portal.
Prepare detailed project report and business plan.
Apply to your nearest bank branch or through portal.
Submit documents and attend bank meetings. Loan will be sanctioned after approval.

schemes.name: Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojana
schemes.description: Financial inclusion program. Open zero-balance bank account with RuPay debit card and insurance benefits.
schemes.eligibility: Any Indian citizen aged 10 years or above. No minimum balance required.
schemes.benefits: Zero-balance savings account. RuPay debit card. Accidental insurance cover of Rs 1 lakh. Overdraft facility up to Rs 10,000 (for eligible accounts).
requiredDocuments: Voter ID or Driving License or Passport (alternative)
howToApply: Visit any bank branch (public or private).
Fill the account opening form.
Submit Aadhaar and one address proof. Provide passport size photo.
Account will be opened immediately. RuPay card will be issued within few days.

schemes.name: Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Yojana
schemes.description: Accidental death and disability insurance. Premium only Rs 20 per year. Cover of Rs 2 lakh for accidental death.
schemes.eligibility: Indian citizen aged 18 to 70 years. Must have a bank account. Auto-debit consent required.
schemes.benefits: Rs 2 lakh for accidental death or full disability. Rs 1 lakh for partial disability. Premium only Rs 20 per year.
howToApply: Visit your bank where you have savings account.
Fill the PMSBY application form and consent form.
Submit Aadhaar copy. Give auto-debit consent.
Premium Rs 20 will be deducted annually. Insurance cover starts immediately.

schemes.name: Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana
schemes.description: Life insurance scheme. Premium Rs 436 per year. Cover of Rs 2 lakh in case of death due to any reason.
schemes.eligibility: Indian citizen aged 18 to 50 years. Must have a bank account. Auto-debit consent required.
schemes.benefits: Rs 2 lakh life cover for death due to any reason. Premium only Rs 436 per year. Can continue till age 55.
howToApply: Visit your bank where you have savings account.
Fill the PMJJBY application form and consent form.
Submit Aadhaar copy and nominee details. Give auto-debit consent.
Premium Rs 436 will be deducted annually. Insurance cover starts immediately.

schemes.name: SVAMITVA Yojana
schemes.description: Scheme to map rural land using drones and provide property cards to rural households.
schemes.eligibility: Rural resident with residential property in Abadi area. Property should be in village areas.
schemes.benefits: Property card with legal recognition. Can use as financial asset for loans. Clear property rights. Reduces disputes.
howToApply: Scheme is implemented by state governments. Check if your village is covered.
Contact your Gram Panchayat or revenue department.
When survey team visits, cooperate in measurement and verification.
Property card will be issued after survey and verification.

schemes.name: Pradhan Mantri Kaushal Vikas Yojana
schemes.description: Skill development and training program. Free training in various trades and skills. Certificate recognized by industry.
schemes.eligibility: Indian citizen, mostly youth who are unemployed or school/college dropouts. No age bar but focus on 15-45 years age group.
schemes.benefits: Free skill training. Monetary reward on certification. Placement assistance. Government-recognized certificate.
howToApply: Visit PMKVY portal or nearest Skill Development Centre.
Choose your preferred skill course (600+ courses available).
Register online or at the centre. Submit documents.
Attend training. Pass assessment. Get certificate and placement support.

schemes.name: Startup India Scheme
schemes.description: Support for startups including tax benefits, funding support, easier compliance, and IPR fast-tracking.
schemes.eligibility: Company incorporated as Private Limited, Partnership or LLP. Up to 10 years from incorporation. Turnover up to Rs 100 crore. Working on innovation/technology.
schemes.benefits: Income tax exemption for 3 years. Self-certification under labour laws. IPR fast-track. Access to funding. Networking opportunities.
howToApply: Visit Startup India portal and register.
Fill the recognition application. Describe your innovation.
Upload company documents and pitch deck.
Get recognition certificate. Apply for various benefits and schemes.

schemes.name: National Scholarship Portal
schemes.description: One-stop portal for all scholarships. Pre-matric, post-matric, merit-based scholarships for students from various backgrounds.
schemes.eligibility: Varies by scheme. Generally for SC/ST/OBC/Minority students, meritorious students, students with disabilities. Income limits apply for many schemes.
schemes.benefits: Financial assistance for education. Covers tuition, books, and living expenses. Amount varies by scheme (Rs 3,000 to Rs 1,20,000).
howToApply: Visit National Scholarship Portal (scholarships.gov.in).
Register with your details. Login and fill application.
Choose relevant scholarships. Upload documents.
Submit application before deadline. Track status on portal.

schemes.name: Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana
schemes.description: Crop insurance scheme for farmers. Protection against crop loss due to natural calamities, pests, diseases.
schemes.eligibility: All farmers (owner or tenant). Mandatory for farmers with crop loan. Voluntary for others. Must have land documents or crop sharing agreement.
schemes.benefits: Up to 90% premium paid by government. Quick settlement of claims. Cover for pre-sowing to post-harvest losses. Technology-based assessment.
requiredDocuments: Land records or crop sharing document
howToApply: Apply within 7 days of sowing through your bank, CSC, or agriculture office.
Fill crop insurance form. Provide land and crop details.
Pay nominal farmer premium (2% for Kharif, 1.5% for Rabi).
In case of crop loss, inform insurance company within 72 hours. Survey will be done and claim settled.

schemes.name: Senior Citizens Savings Scheme
schemes.description: Government-backed savings scheme for senior citizens. High interest rate (around 8%). Quarterly interest payout.
schemes.eligibility: Indian citizen aged 60 years or above. Retired civilian employees (55-60 years) or retired defense personnel (50 years onwards) also eligible.
schemes.benefits: High interest rate (8% or above). Tax benefit under Section 80C up to Rs 1.5 lakh. Quarterly interest payout. Deposit up to Rs 30 lakh.
howToApply: Visit nearest post office or authorized bank.
Fill SCSS account opening form.
Submit KYC documents and proof of age. Deposit amount (Rs 1,000 to Rs 30 lakh).
Account will be opened. Interest will be credited quarterly to your account.

schemes.name: National Agriculture Market (e-NAM)
schemes.description: Online trading platform for agricultural commodities. Farmers can sell directly to buyers across India and get better prices.
schemes.eligibility: Any farmer or trader. Must register on e-NAM portal. Need to visit integrated mandi for trading.
schemes.benefits: Transparent price discovery. Direct access to more buyers. Reduced transaction costs. Online payment. Better prices for produce.
howToApply: Visit nearest e-NAM integrated mandi.
Register with your Aadhaar and bank details.
Get e-NAM card or registration number.
Bring your produce to mandi. Trade online through e-NAM platform and receive payment in bank.

schemes.name: Pradhan Mantri Shram Yogi Maandhan
schemes.description: Pension scheme for unorganized workers earning up to Rs 15,000 per month. Get Rs 3,000 monthly pension after 60 years.
schemes.eligibility: Age 18-40 years. Unorganized worker with monthly income up to Rs 15,000. Not covered under EPF/ESIC/NPS. Not an income taxpayer.
schemes.benefits: Rs 3,000 guaranteed monthly pension after 60 years. Family pension benefit. Low monthly contribution (Rs 55 to Rs 200 based on age).
howToApply: Visit nearest CSC with Aadhaar and bank details.
Fill enrollment form. Provide occupation and income details.
Make first contribution payment.
Auto-debit will be set up for monthly contribution. Pension starts at age 60.

schemes.name: Rashtriya Vayoshri Yojana
schemes.description: Free distribution of assistive living devices to senior citizens from BPL families. Aids and appliances for physical disability.
schemes.eligibility: Senior citizens (60+ years) from BPL category. Suffering from age-related disabilities (low vision, hearing impairment, loss of teeth, locomotor disability).
schemes.benefits: Free assistive devices like walking sticks, wheelchairs, hearing aids, dentures, spectacles, etc. No cost to beneficiary.
howToApply: Visit your nearby Ayushman Bharat Health and Wellness Centre or PHC.
Get assessed by medical professional for assistive device requirement.
Fill application form. Submit BPL card and medical assessment.
Devices will be provided at organized camps. Follow-up services also available.

schemes.name: Namo Shetkari Mahasanman Nidhi Yojana
schemes.description: Maharashtra state scheme giving Rs 6,000 per year to farmers in addition to PM-KISAN (total Rs 12,000 per year).
schemes.eligibility: Must be a farmer in Maharashtra. Already registered under PM-KISAN scheme. All categories of farmers eligible.
schemes.benefits: Rs 6,000 per year (Rs 2,000 per installment, 3 installments). Direct bank transfer. Additional to PM-KISAN benefit.
howToApply: If already in PM-KISAN, you will be automatically enrolled.
Visit Aaple Sarkar portal or nearest Seva Kendra.
Verify your PM-KISAN registration and bank details.
Amount will be credited to your bank account in three installments.

schemes.name: Digital India Programme
schemes.description: Initiative to make government services available electronically. Improve digital infrastructure and digital literacy across India.
schemes.eligibility: All Indian citizens can benefit from various Digital India initiatives like DigiLocker, e-Sign, UMANG app, MyGov portal, etc.
schemes.benefits: Digital documents in DigiLocker. Online government services. Free Wi-Fi in public places. Digital literacy training. E-governance benefits.
howToApply: Download relevant apps (DigiLocker, UMANG, etc.) from Play Store.
Register using your Aadhaar and mobile number.
Access various government services digitally.
For digital literacy training, contact nearest CSC or PMG-DISHA centre.

schemes.name: POSHAN Abhiyaan (National Nutrition Mission)
schemes.description: Programme to improve nutritional outcomes for children, pregnant women and lactating mothers. Focus on reducing malnutrition.
schemes.eligibility: Pregnant women, lactating mothers, children under 6 years. Free services at Anganwadi centres.
schemes.benefits: Supplementary nutrition. Growth monitoring. Nutrition counselling. Immunization. Pre-school education.
howToApply: Visit your nearest Anganwadi centre.
Register pregnant women or children under 6 years.
Regular check-ups and nutrition supplements will be provided.
Track growth and get health advice from Anganwadi worker.

name: PM-Kisan Samman Nidhi
description: Central scheme that gives Rs 6,000 per year in three equal instalments to small and marginal farmer families.
eligibility: You must be a small or marginal farmer. Landholding should be in your name. You should be an Indian citizen.
benefits: Rs 2,000 every 4 months (Rs 6,000 per year) directly in your bank account.
howToApply: Visit the PM-Kisan portal or go to your nearest Common Service Centre (CSC).
Fill the PM-Kisan form with your name, mobile, Aadhaar, bank account and land details.
Submit the form with copies of Aadhaar and land papers.
Your application will be verified. Once approved, money will be sent to your bank account.

name: Atal Pension Yojana
description: A pension scheme for workers in the unorganised sector. You get a fixed pension every month after 60 years of age.
eligibility: You must be between 18 and 40 years. You must have a bank account. You should be an Indian citizen. Mainly for workers without any organised pension.
benefits: Monthly pension of Rs 1,000 to Rs 5,000 after 60 years, depending on your contribution. Government also adds 50% of your contribution for 5 years (up to Rs 1,000 per year).
howToApply: Open an account with any bank that offers Atal Pension Yojana.
Fill the APY form. Choose your monthly pension amount (Rs 1,000 to Rs 5,000).
Give your Aadhaar and bank details. Consent for auto-debit of monthly contribution.
Pay the monthly contribution on time. Pension will start after you turn 60.

name: Ayushman Bharat Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana
description: Health insurance that gives up to Rs 5 lakh per family per year for hospitalisation. No need to pay at the time of treatment.
eligibility: Your family should be in the listed deprived categories (e.g. rural landless, manual workers). Your name should be in the SECC 2011 data. No age limit.
benefits: Cashless treatment up to Rs 5 lakh per family per year in empanelled hospitals. Covers most illnesses and surgeries.
howToApply: Check if your family is eligible on the Ayushman Bharat website or at a Common Service Centre.
If eligible, get your Ayushman card from the nearest hospital or CSC.
Show your Ayushman card and Aadhaar at any empanelled hospital for cashless treatment.
You can also call the helpline 14555 for help.

name: PM Vidya Lakshmi
description: Single online portal to apply for education loans from many banks. Students can compare and apply for loans easily.
eligibility: You must be an Indian citizen. You should be admitted to a recognised course (higher education, professional, vocational). Your course and institute should be approved by the bank.
benefits: One place to apply to multiple banks, track application status, and get education loan without collateral up to Rs 7.5 lakh.
howToApply: Register on the Vidya Lakshmi portal (vidyalakshmi.co.in).
Fill your course and personal details. Choose the loan amount you need.
Select banks and submit the application. Upload required documents.
Banks will contact you. Complete their process and get the loan.

name: National Pension System (NPS)
description: A voluntary pension scheme. You save regularly and get a pension after 60. Open to all Indian citizens.
eligibility: Any Indian citizen between 18 and 70 years can join. You need a bank account and PAN.
benefits: Tax benefits on contribution. After 60, you get a part as lump sum and rest as monthly pension. You can choose how much to invest.
howToApply: Visit the NPS website or go to any bank or post office that offers NPS.
Fill the subscriber registration form. Choose Tier I (pension) or Tier II (savings).
Submit Aadhaar, PAN and bank details. Pay the minimum amount (Rs 500 for opening).
You will get a PRAN (Permanent Retirement Account Number). Contribute regularly online or at the bank.

name: Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana
description: Free LPG connection to women from poor families so they can cook with clean fuel instead of wood or coal.
eligibility: Adult woman from a household that does not have an LPG connection. Family should be in the eligible list (e.g. SC/ST, PMAY, Antyodaya, forest dwellers, most backward classes).
benefits: One free LPG connection (cylinder and regulator). You pay only for the first refill. No deposit for the connection.
requiredDocuments: BPL certificate or eligible category proof
howToApply: Go to your nearest LPG distributor (HP, BPCL, IOCL) with your documents.
Fill the Ujjwala application form. Give Aadhaar, address and BPL/eligibility proof.
Submit the form and documents. You will get a receipt.
After verification, you will get a free LPG connection. Book your first cylinder and pay only for the refill.

name: Mid-Day Meal Scheme
description: Free cooked midday meal for children studying in government and government-aided schools. Improves nutrition and attendance.
eligibility: Your child must be enrolled in a government or government-aided primary/upper primary school (Classes 1 to 8).
benefits: One free nutritious meal every school day. Calories and protein as per guidelines. No cost to the family.
requiredDocuments: Ration card or identity of parent
howToApply: Admit your child in a government or government-aided school (Class 1 to 8).
The school automatically includes eligible children in the mid-day meal list.
No separate form in most states. Child gets the meal on school days.
For any issue, contact the school principal or the district education office.

name: Pradhan Mantri Matru Vandana Yojana
description: Cash benefit for pregnant women and new mothers. Rs 5,000 in instalments for first living child to support nutrition and rest.
eligibility: Pregnant woman or mother of first living child. You should be 19 years or older. Not eligible if you are a government employee or get similar benefits.
benefits: Rs 2,000 in first instalment (after registration), Rs 2,000 after first vaccination, Rs 1,000 after second vaccination (total Rs 5,000).
howToApply: Register at the nearest Anganwadi centre or health centre when you are pregnant.
Fill the PMMVY form. Give Aadhaar, bank account and pregnancy details.
Submit the form with copies of Aadhaar and bank passbook.
After verification, you will get the first instalment. Get your child vaccinated on time to receive the next instalments.
